titleStmt.title: William T. Samuels to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5019

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Auditor's Office, Kentucky.
WILLIAM T. SAMUELS, Auditor.
EDGAR KEENON, Assistant Auditor.
James M. Withrow, Clerk.
Uberto Keenon, Clerk.
R. R. Bacon, Clerk.
John A. Crittenden, Clerk.
Jno. W. Pruett, Jr., Clerk.
Charles T. Miller, Clerk.
John L. Sneed, Clerk.Frankfort, May 25 1864.
Hon Thos E. Bramlette
Govr. of Ky.
Dear Sir.

Execution that issued against W Sharp Clk Lyon Circuit Ct for Rev for years 1858.9 60 in part Int & Costs this day paid. And now pray it Yr Excellency to be relieved of $24.46 being Amnt Damages Adjudged Agst him for the Non Payments of the Rev. for at the time required by law.

Franklin Cir Ct.
vs
W. Sharp
Clk Lyon

WILLIAM T. SAMUELS,
ATTORNEY AT LAW
AND
GENERAL COLLECTING AGENT,
FRANKFORT, KY.
&#9758Special attention given to the collection of all debts confided to him in the State of Kentucky.
